commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Wow, Tokyo is amazing! It has everything!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: There was that cute knick-knack shop and that caf√© with all the birds, and there are tons of school idol shops!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: *Giggle* It really is amazing. I was surprised when I first came here, too. There are so many places where you can experience Japanese karaoke as well.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Yeah. There's so many shops that it's hard to decide where to go.

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: I sometimes buy too many school idol goods because of it, though.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: You can just do that on your way home from school, right? That's awesome. I wanna live in Tokyo, too. Right, Riko?!

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Huh?! I used to live here, you know.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Oh, right. Hehe.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Come on, Chika. I know it's been a while since you've shopped in Tokyo, but you're getting way too carried away.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Because it's so much fun!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: *Giggle* You've fallen in love with Tokyo, huh, Chika-chi? But even though it might seem like Tokyo has everything, there are things it doesn't have.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Huh? Really?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: I bet Numazu has many wonders that can't be found here.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Umm, there are pretty beaches, and the mikan oranges are yummy, and... Also...

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: There are fish...? But I feel like those aren't the things that make Numazu or Uchiura so great.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: I think I know what you mean. I've noticed it since living there, too. There's some sort of indescribable quality to it.

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: Now you two got me curious.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: I know. You should all visit Uchiura! I want you to feel for yourself that thing we can't put into words!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: We can be the ones to show you around next time. You can stay at my place, too.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Your family runs a ryokan inn, right, Chika? Won't we be in the way?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: You can stay in my room. It's fun to sleep all crammed together!

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Crammed together?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: *Giggle* I love sleeping in a room full of people.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Then it's decided! Where should we take you? You might like...

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Hmm. I suppose we could take them to the beach and go out for some tasty food.

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: Tasty food?! I wonder what we'll have.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: And then... Well, it'd be night after that.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Then how about going on a walk and feeling the night breeze? I bet it would feel amazing.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Yes, great idea. A night stroll sounds fun!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: I'll try my best to show you around and make you love Numazu!
